Parameter.ParameterDescription: This specifies the device type. This is important for monitoring systems to determine what to expect from the device. This is not expected to change for a device. Mandatory status parameter for all devices.

The Heartbeat is sent at regular intervals, so that the operator can see that device driver is working. Its value is the date-time in seconds when the next heartbeat will be published. This allows an operator to see if the device driver has failed. Mandatory status parameter for all devices.

This is a special parameter that is not visible to device driver or to operator. It can be used for every device. This parameter is like heartbeat, but is generated by the server that provisioned the device at a configurable interval. It provides a heartbeat type signal when the device driver fails. This will allow red side to detect black side devices on startup when the device driver is not working.

This is a special parameter that is not visible to device driver or to operator. It can be used for every device. This parameter is sent when a device is deleted and in response to "Send Parameters" for a device that does not exist (and is assumed deleted).

No parameter. Allows administrator to request device to send current values of all status and control parameters. Used by Red/Black (Red Side) on startup. Mandatory Control Parameter for all devices. This is used by Red side server to ensure that device information is up to date, and by black side server to get all information on device driver startup. It is also presented to the end user as a "Refresh Device Information" option, to force getting all parameters from the device. Rate control in support of covert channel protection. Request max frequency of 10 minutes.

Device driver reports on device status. Enumerated: "Operational"; "Partly Operational"; "Not Operational". This can give red/green/amber display for the device. Status parameter, expected to be used by most devices.
Date-time in seconds when monitoring of device was started. Provided for all devices.
Date-time in seconds when device was started while in current monitoring run. Allows display of device up time. Provided for all devices.
Date-time in seconds when device was started. Allows display of device up time. Provided by device.
A string indicating the software/firmware/hardware version of the device. Parameter which majority of devices are expected to use. This is a status parameter, with information coming from the device.

Describes the device instance. Control Parameter which will be used by most devices to allow description to be added to each device. Setting from Black Side only is sensible for deployments concerned about covert channel. This can be changed if the convenience of red side setting is desired.
Some devices, such as M-Guard Black Side can be connected to various types of devices. This specifies the type of device to which this specific instance can be connected.
Enables device to be made active or put on standby. devices where operator may wish to do this. Useful for Control parameter that will be used for many devices.
This is an Alert type parameter, which allows publication of device alerts of varying severity. Status parameter that will be used by most devices.
Reference to one or more devices associated with the device, such as a the device a thermometer is measuring, or the devices that a UPS powers

No parameter. Allows administrator or operator to reset/restart the device.
Control parameter that will be supported by many devices. Operator is allowed to set this. Rate control in support of covert channel protection. Reset max frequency of 10 minutes.

Allows administrator or operator to power off the device. Control parameter that will be supported by many devices. Operator is allowed to set this. This is one way. Device status expected to go to "not operational" after this command

This is a parameter used in switch type devices. It specifies which outbound element the inbound element is pointed to. Operators can set this to control switch configuration. Upper bound is also constrained by the maximum number of elements in the Connect To parameter.

This is a hash of the XML describing the device type. It is used to detect inconsistencies between red and black side specification of a device. The hash is implementation depependent, so depends on red and black side using the same hash.
This is a unique identifier generated by Red/Black for the device. It enables simple unambiguous reference of the device instance.
A URL that can be accessed to manage the device. This can be displayed by Red/Black to enable convenient access to Web management of the device
This provides activation information on the product, such as that provided by the activation capability in Isode products.
